column4: How can you connect to a router that is behind another router
How can you connect to a router that is behind another router
connect the Wan port of one router to an LAN port on the other
!ask|psilo-
I tryed that it seem not to work
Set-up the one with the WAN plugged in to static ip
on the main router I have the sec one plug into number four port, on the sec router I have it plug into the WAN
also it has the IP address that it assied using the first router
I don't understand why its not working it gives me a screen that says can't establish a connection to the server at 192.168.1.107.
is that screen on the router or your computer?
its the DD-WRT fireware
its on the brower
can you ping the first router?
yes I am login to the first router
I want to look back and forth to setup the seting that I did on the first one
on the second router did you set the DNS to the address of the first router"?
no
is that the problem
Set the DNS and you should be fine.  I'm on a computer behind two routers as we type.
brb
ok, which is your first and which is your second?  Are you able to ping both routers?
from a workstation behind the second (d-link) router are you able to ping the first (linksys) router?
